metadata.title: CVE-2017-7679 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
In Apache httpd 2.2.x before 2.2.33 and 2.4.x before 2.4.26, mod_mime canread one byte past the end of a buffer when sending a maliciousContent-Type response header.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7679` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.3
apache2-bin - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.3
apache2-data - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.3
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.3
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.3
apache2-utils - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.18-2ubuntu3.3').
